title: Once Upon a Tide: Singapore's Journey Exhibition
blurb: Explore Singapore's transformation from settlement to city.
description: Embark on a captivating journey through Singapore's rich maritime history and its evolution from a humble settlement to a global metropolis. This exhibition showcases the pivotal role of the sea in shaping Singapore's identity, economy, and culture. Discover fascinating artifacts, historical documents, and interactive displays that bring to life the stories of early settlers, maritime trade, and the nation's remarkable progress. Perfect for families and history enthusiasts, this exhibition offers an engaging and educational experience for all ages. Explore the exhibits and learn about Singapore's past.
Keyword_tag: Singapore history, maritime history, Singapore culture, family activities, museum exhibition

title: Once Upon a Tide Special Exhibition at National Museum
blurb: Embark on a voyage through Singapore's transformation.
description: In commemoration of Singapore’s 60th year of independence, the National Museum’s special exhibition Once Upon a Tide invites you to embark on a voyage through the ebbs and flows of the island’s transformation from a bustling port to a global powerhouse. Journey through Singapore’s 700-year history and discover how the sea and river have shaped Singapore’s evolution, witnessing the constant flows of people, goods, and ideas that have together woven the fabric of the nation. Uncover the many connections that have positioned Singapore at the crossroads of the world, and play your part in envisioning Singapore’s future! The exhibition brings visitors across five immersive sections, each representing different aspects of Singapore’s evolution brought to life through experiential storytelling.
Keyword_tag: Singapore history, maritime history, cultural exhibition, family activities, museum visit

title: Get Curious! Building Our Singapore Installation
blurb: Interactive installation celebrating contributions of migrants.
description: Complement your Once Upon a Tide experience with Get Curious! Building Our Singapore! Located just outside the exhibition gallery, this interactive installation celebrates the invaluable contributions of our past and present-day migrants through three engaging stops: Stop 1: Time Traveller’s Zone – An immersive photo opportunity where visitors can imagine being an early migrant. Stop 2: World Explorer’s Map – Discover some of the countries that the different communities in Singapore originate from. Stop 3: “Thank You” Corner – Pick up a postcard and pen a thank-you note to those who have helped build our nation. This installation is family-friendly and offers an engaging experience for all ages. Explore Singapore's history and culture through interactive exhibits and activities.
datetime_display: Daily, 10am – 7pm (early admission at 9.30am available for school group bookings)
Keyword_tag: Singapore history, migrant contributions, interactive installation, family activities, museum visit

title: Once Upon A Tide Exhibition at National Museum
description: The exhibition brings visitors across five immersive sections, each representing different aspects of Singapore’s evolution brought to life through experiential storytelling. Trace our island's deep historical roots. Discover key artefacts showcasing Singapore's status as one of the key port settlements in the Malay world and Chinese trade network, long before settlement by the British in 1819. See if you can locate Singapore across different ancient maps! Sail through the history of the Singapore River, the lifeblood of our early settlement and a vital player in the development of industries such as coaling and shipbuilding. Take on the Sampan Challenge game and row across the Singapore River, navigating obstacles and battling the elements to safely deliver your passengers to their destination.
Keyword_tag: Singapore history, historical artifacts, Singapore River, Sampan Challenge, museum exhibition

title: Self-guided interactive installation: Get Curious!
blurb: Complement your Once Upon a Tide experience!
description: Discover the invaluable contributions of our past and present-day migrants through three engaging stops: Time Traveller’s Zone – An immersive photo opportunity where visitors can imagine being an early migrant. World Explorer’s Map – Discover some of the countries that the different communities in Singapore originate from. This interactive installation celebrates the invaluable contributions of our past and present-day migrants. Perfect for families and children to learn about Singapore's history in an engaging way. Explore the exhibits and enjoy a fun and educational experience.
Keyword_tag: Interactive installation, migrants, Singapore history, family activity, children's learning

title: Once Upon A Tide Exhibition - Waves of Wonder
blurb: Embark on self-guided visits with family-friendly captions.
description: Younger audiences and families can embark on self-guided visits with the exhibition’s 11 Waves of Wonder family-friendly captions, co-created with educators from My First Skool. Each caption contains bite-sized information and a mission-based activity to encourage children to get curious about the artefacts. To encourage young visitors and students with additional needs to better engage with the exhibition’s content, the National Museum has also created a complementary and purpose-built Programmes Cart with age-appropriate hands-on activities that pre-school and special needs schools can use during their self-guided visits to the exhibition. Complementary resources will also be progressively available for student groups of various levels.
datetime_display: friendly captions, co-created with educators from My First Skool
Keyword_tag: family-friendly, exhibition, artefacts, children, educational, activities

title: Once Upon A Tide Exhibition Navigator's Adventure
blurb: Educational resource for ages 9 & up. Discoveries!
description: Follow the flow of the Once Upon A Tide exhibition and record your discoveries in a specially created resource booklet. Educators are encouraged to use this booklet as part of a self-facilitated learning journey relating to Primary 4 and 5 Social Studies learner outcomes, in particular learning about Singapore’s early history and the contributions of settlers. This exhibition is family-friendly and suitable for children aged 9 and above, offering an engaging and educational experience about Singapore's maritime history.
Keyword_tag: Singapore history, maritime history, educational resource, children's activity, family-friendly exhibition

title: Once Upon a Tide: Stories of the Singapore River
blurb: Explore the milestones and memories of Singapore River.
description: Discover the Singapore River's integral role in our history, mirroring the island's evolution from a 14th-century port to a global powerhouse. This collection of stories, written by the National Museum of Singapore’s curatorial team, commemorates Singapore’s 60th year of independence. Explore the milestones and memories of the Singapore River and its surrounding seas as the historical origin of our connections with the world. From ancient ceramics unearthed near the Singapore River, to the catalytic effect of the Suez Canal on Singapore’s port and harbour, and representations of the river in our cultural imagination, Once Upon a Tide invites you to discover how past and present connections between Singapore’s river, sea and identity continue to shape the currents of our future.
Keyword_tag: Singapore River, history, museum, exhibition, Singapore

title: National Museum of Singapore Ticketing Promotions
blurb: Enjoy discounts and benefits from our partners!
description: The National Museum of Singapore offers various ticketing promotions in partnership with HSBC. Card members can enjoy discounts on general admission tickets and selected merchandise at the museum shop. These promotions provide opportunities for visitors to explore the museum's exhibitions and collections at a reduced cost. The museum aims to enhance the visitor experience through these partnerships, making cultural enrichment more accessible. These promotions are valid until 9 October 2026, allowing ample time for visitors to take advantage of the offers. The museum showcases Singapore's rich history and cultural heritage through innovative and engaging exhibits.
Keyword_tag: Museum, exhibitions, history, culture, discounts, promotions, HSBC

title: Collecting Contemporary Singapore: Wave Makers
blurb: Share stories of Singaporean 'Wave Makers' on the stage.
description: In conjunction with this exhibition, this edition of Collecting Contemporary Singapore invites contributions of items and stories of Singaporean 'Wave Makers' who have made us proud on the global stage. Share it with us, and help us tell more diverse stories of Singaporeans who have made their mark on the world. Sections include Introduction, The Exhibition, Interactive Installation, Waves of Wonder Publication, Ticketing Promotions, Public call for Wave Makers Highlights. The exhibition aims to highlight Singaporeans who have made a significant impact globally.
Keyword_tag: Singaporean Wave Makers, contemporary Singapore, exhibition, interactive installation

title: National Museum of Singapore Exhibitions and Displays
blurb: Explore Singapore's history and culture through exhibits.
description: The National Museum of Singapore offers a variety of exhibitions showcasing Singapore's rich history and cultural heritage. Visitors can explore artifacts, historical documents, and interactive displays that tell the story of Singapore from its early beginnings to the present day. The museum features exhibits on diverse topics such as maritime history, local communities, and significant historical events. It provides an engaging and educational experience for families and visitors of all ages, with family-friendly activities and interactive elements designed to spark curiosity and learning. Discover the stories behind Singapore's past and gain a deeper understanding of its cultural identity through the museum's extensive collections and thoughtfully curated exhibitions.
datetime_display: monly used by Chinese sailors from the late 11th to early 12th centuries onwards, although the Chinese admiral Zheng He (郑和), who sailed in the 14th century, preferred more advanced compasses with 48 cardinal points
Keyword_tag: Singapore history, cultural heritage, exhibitions, family-friendly, interactive displays
